JobFullDesc: Facebook is looking for a Privacy Policy Manager with expertise in privacy and public policy issues related to minors, especially technology-related issues, to join our Privacy and Data Policy team and help us build products in the best interests of people under 18. We're seeking a hard working, self-motivated individual, who thrives in fast-paced environments and can seamlessly drive success bringing together the perspectives of experts outside the company and cross-functional teams working on the hardest privacy problems the company is facing. You’ll focus on stakeholder engagement and providing strategic guidance for internal teams to ensure we’re building products that reflect best practices for age-appropriate online experiences for young people. This role is highly collaborative and will involve partnering with policy, communications and other cross-functional partners. You'll also serve as a subject matter expert for Facebook's global policy team on Facebook's youth products and work with our teams to evaluate and respond to external policy developments, and to engage with external experts on youth privacy around the world. The ideal candidate for this role is a self-starter, a good team player, and creative problem solver that is able to switch easily between detailed work and high-level strategic thinking. This candidate will be deeply familiar with privacy issues for young people online. This candidate will also have a meaningful understanding of stakeholders and perspectives in the youth privacy community, and a desire to build partnerships between Facebook and external privacy stakeholders. Candidates should be accomplished at building and managing relationships as well as strategic thinking.
